## Model.findByIdAndRemove() method

Issue a mongodb findAndModify remove command by a document's \_id field. findByIdAndRemove(id, ...) is equivalent to findOneAndRemove(<!-- -->{ \_id: id }<!-- -->, ...). Finds a matching document, removes it, passing the found document (if any) to the callback. Executes immediately if callback is passed, else a Query object is returned.

If mongoose option 'useFindAndModify': set to false it uses native findOneAndUpdate() rather than deprecated findAndModify(). https://mongoosejs.com/docs/api.html\#mongoose\_Mongoose-set

Note: same signatures as findByIdAndDelete

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
findByIdAndRemove<T extends Document>(this: Ctor<T>): DocumentQuery<T | null, T, QueryHelpers> & QueryHelpers;
```

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  this | [Ctor](./goosetyped.ctor.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt; |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

DocumentQuery&lt;T \| null, T, QueryHelpers&gt; &amp; QueryHelpers
